title: Adjusted regex build system
body:
I changed the configuration to list subdirectories, and also modified the build system to walk into each to do the entire process again.

However, other configuration items in that target are the same for all subdirectories. Tell me if that's a problem.

title: Notify users that UCRSV is no longer being worked on
body:
Mention that we plan to stop working on UCRSV because of the new banner changes. A brief explanation in the about section would be nice for those looking for justification and further information about how to pick up where we left off if they so desire.

Issue #87 will be the last feature we implement. For the following weeks we will maintain the site and watch for bugs in case we miss an edge case in parsing the Banner schedule.

title: Switch from GROWL to Banner format
body:
UCR's switched to Banner from GROWL.

We need to update the regex and update [CourseParser.js](https://github.com/BradleyCai/ucr-schedule-visualizer/blob/gh-pages/js/CourseParser.js) so that the website can parse Banner's format.

The website could take both Banner and GROWL inputs.

title: Added Google Calendar integration
body:
Demo available [here](http://www.cs.ucr.edu/~jgome043/ucr-schedule-visualizer). I've left my api key in the repo for convenience and have already authorized it to work from bradleycai.github.io. 

It's not a perfect implementation in my eyes, but it works.

title: Refactor all the Javascript
body:
There was a design meeting where the new structure for UCR-SV was discussed. The goals are modularity, ease of implementation and maintenance, and simple design.

The "main" javascript code will be moved directly to the HTML, and will invoke all the other JS sources in a library-like fashion. Each file will be self-contained and perform one and only function. The currently planned modules are:
- Course
- Schedule
- Parser
- Renderer
- Notification
- Hooks

The general flowchart of the application is that input will be given, be passed to the parser to generate course objects, which is used to generate a schedule object. Any hooks or errors along the way will be dealt with, and then all parts of the result are rendered. Also included is a new side panel to add more actions other than just "save to an image".

title: No handling for out-of-range classes
body:
Classes before 7AM or after 10PM cannot be rendered. We should have some way of being able to being able to display them. Possible resolutions:
- Dynamic expansion of the calendar when needed
- Visually truncating the calendar

title: Minify js
body:
We should minify our js since it's growing bigger everyday.

We'll add a `.min.js` file for each of our regular `.js` files and then run the `.min.js` files in the website instead of the `.js` ones like we currently do.

To do this we should write a script to minify our js every time we modify or add js.

title: Add better naming to the downloaded calender
body:
Currently the picture downloads to "UCR-Schedule-Visualized.png" and only that. 

To help people with organizing their visualized schedules, it should name the file to something specific that defines that schedule.

Something like "UCRSV-SPRING-2016.png" or similar.

title: LibreJS blocks our website's Javascript
body: LibreJS is a plugin that blocks Javascript that does not respect user's freedoms from being run on their computer. All the JS used on our site is free software, but LibreJS is still blocking it.

title: Button to manually add a course
body:
It might be useful to add a course just to see how a custom schedule will look like, and it can also be used at a backup strategy for when the regex fails to pick up a course. 

Whoever picks this issue up must discuss the specific design and functionality of their implementation with the team before actually writing it.

title: Add more to the QR code
body: There should be the title of our project on top and the link on the bottom.

title: Add color to the background of courses
Google Calender
body: Add Google Calendar api integration. The user can choose to carry the generated UCR Schedule Visualizer calendar over to their Google Calendar.
